title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 October 2014 - XWiki
content:

10:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <Eduard\_Munteanu> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Hi. How can I verify (in a crypto sense) XWiki downloads?  
10:48 <cjd> what is the threat model?  
10:48 <vmassol> man in the middle?  
10:49 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Yes, MITM.  
10:49 <vmassol> we have hashes in maven repo  
10:49 <vmassol> for exazmple http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/6.2.3/  
10:49 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Would that require me to build XWiki instead of getting a binary?  
10:49 <vmassol> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/6.2.3/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-6.2.3.pom.asc  
10:49 <vmassol> you can compare the download you get with this  
10:50 <vmassol> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/6.2.3/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-6.2.3.pom.sha1  
10:50 <cjd> yeap, that sounds like a good approach, sha1 it and compare to the hash because unless the man in the middle is extremely clever and persistent, he won't change the hash as well  
10:50 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Hm, it doesn't seem to support HTTPS though.  
10:50 <vmassol> yes we're moving the whole xwiki.org to https but it's not done yet  
10:50 <Eduard\_Munteanu> I know it's sort of unlikely, but I kinda make it a rule to verify my downloads.  
10:51 <cjd> bad tor exit --> switch tor exits and download twice...  
10:51 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Well, it would be enough to get a fingerprint for the signing key.  
10:51 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Securely, again. :)  
10:52 <cjd> what's the threat model  
10:52 <cjd> if you're worried about the nsa, don't worry, they're inside your intel chip <3  
10:52 <Inge-> no https support? MITM fixed your hashes too  
10:52 <Eduard\_Munteanu> MiTM, and the reason I'm adamant about it is it's cheap and easy to enforce a practically insurmontable barrier.  
10:53 <cjd> practically insurmontable  <-- pwning a CA costs about 100k€  getting a certificate to anything you want costs less, usually you can just social engineer one  
10:54 <cjd> https://www.sslshopper.com/article-ssl-certificate-for-mozilla.com-issued-without-validation.html  
10:54 <cjd> eg  
10:55 <Eduard\_Munteanu> So it's not just that "we don't implement https because it sucks anyway" but "huh, crypto? What's that?"  
10:55 <cjd> /nod  
10:56 <cjd> won't argue w/ you there, but if the objective is to complain that xwiki.org doesn't have an ssl cert, open in issue  
10:56 <vmassol> xwiki sas who is hosting all servers for the xwiki.org project has bought the CAs already, some papers are on their way and then they'll do the swtich to https  
10:56 <vmassol> no need  
10:56 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Ok, I will. In the meanwhile I'll try fetching a package from a distro.  
10:57 <vmassol> to open anything  
10:57 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Ah.  
10:57 <vmassol> it's on its way already  
10:58 <Eduard\_Munteanu> One thing I'd do if I didn't have certs is publish the signing key on github and other few places.  
10:58 <Eduard\_Munteanu> In effect, you get github to be a CA of sorts.  
10:59 <Eduard\_Munteanu> (since they give you https)  
11:03 <cjd> sorry for being confrontational about the security stuff, I just spend quite a bit of time thinking about risk and I find that one of the biggest impediments to real security is that instead of trying to visualize the threats that they don't know, people spend way too much time trying to lock down whatever vulns they do know of, regardless of whether the threat is realistic  
11:03 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
11:04 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <Eduard\_Munteanu> The threat model is probably unrealistic, yeah, but plugging the hole is also incredibly cheap.  
11:05 <cjd> /nod  
11:08 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Are you aware of any distro that packages XWiki? I could only find an Arch PKGBUILD so far.  
11:10 <Eduard\_Munteanu> I should google for the exact hashes in that maven repo.  
11:10 <cjd> download the .zip, sha1 it, google the sha1  
11:10 <cjd> ;)  
11:10 <yaronr> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <yaronr> Hi  
11:11 <yaronr> I would like to install xwiki + tomcat with an existing MySQL  
11:11 <yaronr> I saw 'xwiki-enterprise-tomcat-common'  
11:11 <yaronr> But I'm looking for a more detailed tutorial  
11:12 <cjd> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationTomcat  
11:13 <yaronr> cjd thanks. I was looking to use the deb package installer, and then point it to mySQL  
11:21 <yaronr> has left #xwiki  
11:34 <Pbas> Hello, I don't know if you saw this, but it seems that your http://dev.xwiki.org/ site have a rendering problem (CSS, encodage?) from internet. Here a screenshot from FF: http://snag.gy/tGWgT.jpg  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> Pbas: have you tried to refresh your browser's cache?  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> Pbas: we know it but it should have been fixed  
11:36 <Pbas> yes and I try from IE too  
11:36 <vmassol> works for me, strange  
11:36 <vmassol> (chrome)  
11:37 <gdelhumeau> work for me (FF)  
11:37 <Pbas> I pass throug a proxy and I didn't check at home  
11:37 <vmassol> and ff  
11:37 <vmassol> seems to be something on your side Pbas  
11:37 <vmassol> I'm logged in though  
11:37 <vmassol> are you logged in?  
11:38 <Pbas> no  
11:38 <Pbas> I will check tonight  
11:39 <vmassol> works for me when logged out too  
11:40 <Pbas> from IE (and same proxy) it's work  
11:42 <vmassol> it works or it doesn't work? :)  
11:42 <Pbas> on Seven/FF 32.0.3 and Debian/iceweasel 31.1.0 it doesn't work  
11:42 <Pbas> On ie9 it's working  
11:43 <Pbas> Ha now it is ok  
11:43 <vmassol> yes it's cache  
11:44 <vmassol> was going to say that  
11:44 <Pbas> mine or your cache?  
11:44 <vmassol> yours  
11:44 <vmassol> ;)  
11:44 <vmassol> there's no reason it works on some browsers and not  
11:44 <Pbas> strange. sorry then  
11:44 <vmassol> \*not others  
11:45 <Pbas> For my defense first it wasn't working on IE and FF  
11:46 <Pbas> Now your site is nice and clean :)  
11:46 <vmassol> cool  
11:52 <gdelhumeau> maybe it comes from the proxy  
11:52 <gdelhumeau> since now he send a special http header  
11:52 <gdelhumeau> maybe the proxy filters it  
11:52 <gdelhumeau> ah ok, cache issue  
11:52 <gdelhumeau> sorry  
11:53 <Pbas> Ctrl F5 is stronger than F5 :) sign: "Pascal expert in false alert?"

16:05 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Argh, I can't really build xwiki with just what's on github and the central Maven repo, can I?  
16:06 <Eduard\_Munteanu> There are all sorts of unsatisfied dependencies.  
16:07 <cjd> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
16:07 <cjd> need to use the maven.xwiki.org repo  
16:07 <cjd> err nexus  
16:08 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Yeah, I've seen that, I was hoping there was a way to build the enterprise WAR without it.  
16:09 <cjd> it's due to dependencies which are not in maven  
16:10 <Eduard\_Munteanu> Any other repo that has those and is hosted on https?  
16:11 <cjd> each one is from a different location and I think they're in the nexus repo because they're not in any other repo  
16:12 <vmassol> s/which are not in maven/which are not in the maven central repo  
16:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
17:00 <Denis> has quit  
17:06 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
17:09 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:30 <Lyes> has quit  
17:40 <lucaa> has quit  
17:45 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you think we need a separate module for bootswatch themes?  
17:45 <vmassol> why should we care it's about bootswatch?  
17:45 <vmassol> and shouldn't we have theme as themes in flamingo-theme?  
17:45 <vmassol> (along with the default flamingo theme)  
17:46 <vmassol> (Charcoal)  
17:46 <vmassol> since we copied them from bootswatch they're now our themes  
17:46 <vmassol> does it also mean that in the UI you plan to have a "bootswtach" category when listing all the themes?  
17:47 <vmassol> (I don't think it makes sense)  
17:49 <vmassol> BTW I don't understand why we have http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/FlamingoColorTheme  
17:49 <vmassol> since Charcoal is in the "Flamingo Theme Application" extension  
17:49 <vmassol> and http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Flamingo+Theme+Application doesn't even show Charcoal  
17:51 <gdelhumeau> I have created a separated application because:  
17:52 <Eduard\_Munteanu> has quit  
17:52 <gdelhumeau> - as a "tribute" to bootswatch  
17:52 <gdelhumeau> - because they aer a bit special: they use the 'lessCode' field and are not easy to customize. See: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Bootswatch+Themes+for+Flamingo  
17:53 <gdelhumeau> I also would like to create new themes, but basic ones that does not use the lessCode field  
17:53 <gdelhumeau> just to show how to have different themes using the basic technology  
17:53 <gdelhumeau> and these themes would be along Charcoal, on the Flamingo Theme App  
17:54 <gdelhumeau> BTW I wonder if I should set "(from Bootswatch)" on the title of these themes. Maybe confusing for the user  
17:55 <gdelhumeau> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/FlamingoColorTheme was usefull when we did not have the Flamingo Theme Application  
17:55 <gdelhumeau> because it is an old color theme, which works well with Flamingo, but an old color theme  
17:55 <gdelhumeau> it is not usefull anymore  
17:55 <gdelhumeau> let me update the doc  
18:00 <gdelhumeau> I hope it is more clear now  
18:00 <gdelhumeau> about creating a new app for bootswatch: it also for maintenance  
18:01 <gdelhumeau> to clearly states that they are special and should be maintain by getting the last version on bootswatch.com (+ some customizations) instead of fixing it  
18:01 <cjd> has quit  
18:09 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
18:10 <vmassol> I don't see why we need a new module for that  
18:10 <vmassol> my problem is that in term of doc it's not very nice  
18:10 <vmassol> for end users  
18:10 <vmassol> they go to the Flmainog Theme app and they won't see them  
18:10 <vmassol> or if there's a link to the other app then it's not clear why it's in a different place  
18:13 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: so we stil need to show Charcoal in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Flamingo+Theme+Application doc  
18:20 <lucaa> has quit  
18:29 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:50 <ebullient> would anything dire happend if I just dropped the contents of the attachment\_archive?  
18:50 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
18:50 <ebullient> would it prevent working with the associated documents? or will things recover if not found.. ?  
18:51 <vmassol> ebullient: you know that we have a script to move to fileystem for attachments right?  
18:51 <ebullient> that would likely require that I am on a newer version of xwiki than this old beast is  
18:52 <ebullient> it is so big, it blows up any attempt to migrate it  
18:52 <vmassol> I know XWiki SAS has migrated really really big DBs of xwiki  
18:52 <ebullient> (and Hi, Vincent! it's been years.. so you won't remember me.. ;) )  
18:53 <vmassol> hey :)  
18:53 <vmassol> now  
18:53 <vmassol> there's an option in xwiki.cfg to disable attachment archiving I believe  
18:53 <vmassol> if that's what you want  to do  
18:54 <vmassol> what version are you on btw?  
18:54 <vmassol> # xwiki.store.attachment.versioning=1  
18:54 <vmassol> # storage.attachment.recyclebin=1  
18:54 <vmassol> # xwiki.store.rollbackattachmentwithdocuments=1  
18:55 <vmassol> I'm pretty sure it's possible to migrate  
18:55 <vmassol> in a reasonable amount of time  
18:56 <vmassol> but it probably requires some expertise  
18:56 <mflorea1> has quit  
18:58 <yaronr> has joined #xwiki  
19:05 <ebullient> I am not kidding. This one instance is (still) Xwiki 1.0  
19:05 <ebullient> it was let loose years ago  
19:05 <ebullient> and was already 9GB big (almost instantly)  
19:06 <vmassol> that's a nice challenge :)  
19:06 <ebullient> yes. it's ridiculous  
19:06 <ebullient> the full backup now is 32GB  
19:06 <ebullient> and most of that is attachment archives  
19:06 <vmassol> would be an interesting upgrade  
19:06 <ebullient> because.. well. they are all in the DB!  
19:06 <Lyes> has quit  
19:07 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
19:07 <vmassol> is this a business project where there would be a budget to perform this upgrade? Does it contain data that's important to keep.  
19:07 <vmassol> ?  
19:08 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
19:08 <ebullient> heh.  
19:08 <ebullient> this is a development effort that I've been manning in my spare time  
19:08 <ebullient> it just happens also to be enormous  
19:09 <ebullient> and no, no budget. people "need it" but not enough to fork out extra $$  
19:09 <ebullient> =)  
19:15 <ebullient> so. I know this is moldy oldy code that no one remembers  
19:15 <ebullient> but what do you reckon  
19:16 <ebullient> if I purge the archive (which is HUGE).. would that hurt?  
19:16 <ebullient> I want to keep the current versions of attachments..  
19:16 <ebullient> but I don't think anyone will fall over if the old ones go away  
19:17 <vmassol> ok got it  
19:17 <vmassol> I was looking at existing snippets on extensions.xwiki.org  
19:17 <vmassol> to see if we have one for removing archives  
19:17 <vmassol> but I cannot find one that does just that  
19:18 <vmassol> I don't know too well this part of the code  
19:18 <vmassol> if you have a backup then try it out ;)  
19:18 <vmassol> it should work I think  
19:18 <Lyes> has quit  
19:19 <vmassol> schema is here btw: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DatabaseSchema  
19:19 <vmassol> since nothing points to attachment\_archive it should be ok I guess  
19:21 <OSIMasson> has quit  
19:27 <ebullient> y. that was my thought  
19:27 <ebullient> I'll do the next backup differently  
19:27 <ebullient> so that one is sitting all alone, and then ditch it  
19:27 <ebullient> \*headache\*
